answers.answer: Been there, done that. :(  I went in for my glucose test and the levels came back slightly out of range.  I did the three hour blood  work and my results came back normal.  Sometimes levels can be high if you eat sugar or high carb foods on the day of the glucose test.  Try not to worry too much...even if you do have gestational diabetes, it shouldn't be dangerous to the baby and your doctor will be monitoring you closely.  Hope your test goes well.  Make sure you bring food for after the test...I barely made it to the hospital cafeteria after the test because I was so dizzy.

The 3 hour is not fun, you get double the sugar, on your empty stomach. They wouldn't even let me drink some water to get rid of the taste. You get poked 4 times...But it's very well possible you'll be OK. They take 4 values and you can have 1 high. My first time 1h was 139 and I failed the 3h, second time 1h was 159 and I passed the 3h... (and I was sleeping inbetween the blood drawings since I was in the hospital), so it's hard to say if walking inbetween will help... Anyway, you're 30w already so in 4-6w your sugar will lower again because your placenta gets older so if you have it it will only be for a couple of weeks. Good luck to you!

I have gestational diabetes, so they say... they didn't tell me that if I walked it would likely lower my blood sugar levels and they also didn't tell me not to smoke, which can raise blood sugar levels...Now, I'm paying the price, watching everyone around me eat breads, cereals, ice cream, cake, etc. I'm just praying it goes away after baby is born....

I am hoping that they are just having me come in to do this to be extra careful.My husband has had type 1 since he was 7 so I know much a pain it can be!I am more not looking forward to the 3 hour waiting then anything else...the nasty juice does not help either!

I am hoping that they are just having me come in to do this to be extra careful.My husband has had type 1 since he was 7 so I know much a pain it can be!I am more not looking forward to the 3 hour waiting then anything else...the nasty juice does not help either!

I was 3 points off when I did my 1 hr. The Dr.'s cut off is 140 and i was at 143. My Dr. wouldn't have been concerned and would have just let me go, but my first son was over 9 lbs and sometimes that can be a cause of GD in subsequent pregnancy. Well, my numbers were completely nornmal for the 3 hour test. I am just bound to have big babies. My Dr. said this one is going to be about the same size as the first. Just bring a good book or if you like needle work that would also be something to pass the time. I did mine in the Dr. office and I wasn't allowed to leave, due to common side effects such as dizziness and getting really tired.
Mine is the same way...I have to stay there the whole time.Could this mean that this is going to be a big baby?

question: I just went for my 30 week apt. and was told that my glucose test came back back 3 points off. I was not giving the number.I have to go back anyday this week and do a 3 hour test!!!!!Has anyone else had to so this?I know they say that just cause you have to test again it does not always mean you have it.
title: gestational diabetes
